TopicTitle: Any current and working mod manager application?

Articles.Content:
i have been lurking in this forum since i bough the game on steam, and i always end up with a 1gb mod folder that i delete after a new gamechanging patch hits, however it has become quite annoying after a while and it has become really hard to know which mods keep up to date and other stuff. While i want ksp to have a working steam workshop i think is not possible for the moments, so if anyone knows any application that works as a mod manager for ksp that at leasts let me know what i have installed and all that please tell me D: .

Also extra question, is there any mod that adds more parts for making land based vehicles to explore a planet? or propeller planes?

one of them is CKAN:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/100067-The-Comprehensive-Kerbal-Archive-Network-%28CKAN%29-Package-Manager

you can save/import the modlist (up left button).

ther is also a plugin ( i don't use nor remember it) that allow to re-install the manually added mod.

it's not the only one.

Mod manager - CKAN, as above, or TinkerTime

Propeller planes - KAX or FireSpitter

Rovers - ASET or USI Exploration Pack

CKAN has the one problem that if you somehow lose a file from a mod, it willl never know and fix that for you, so you have to uninstall and reinstall the mod. Other than that, I love it.

- - - Updated - - -

Oh, another nitpick: you can't flag a mod as "favourite" or anything like that, so if you uninstall one for debugging purposes, you have to keep track of it yourself.
Thanks didnt know ckan existed, and i thought firespitter was abandoned!

CKAN has the one problem that if you somehow lose a file from a mod, it willl never know and fix that for you, so you have to uninstall and reinstall the mod. Other than that, I love it.

- - - Updated - - -

Oh, another nitpick: you can't flag a mod as "favourite" or anything like that, so if you uninstall one for debugging purposes, you have to keep track of it yourself.

Not quite true. You can export a .ckan file with your currently installed mods (File -> export installed mods). Then if you want to restore you load the list from that file (File -> install from .ckan).

Not quite true. You can export a .ckan file with your currently installed mods (File -> export installed mods). Then if you want to restore you load the list from that file (File -> install from .ckan).

Yeah, that's a new feature indeed. Haven't tried it yet, tho.
